intro: Tithymalus barrelieri subsp. carnicus, commonly known as the Carpathian tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to the Carpathian Mountains. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in forested areas. Its flowers are small and white to pale yellow, and it blooms from June to August. It is a relatively rare species, with limited distribution and specific habitat requirements.
